overview: A computer vision system for recognizing standard playing cards using template matching. Assumes a black background and standard card designs for robust detection.
goals: Detect and classify the rank and suit of a playing card from an image or webcam feed.
Handle perspective distortion and varying lighting.
Provide confidence metrics for each detection.
Support both webcam and image upload inputs.
method: Convert input to grayscale and apply adaptive thresholding.
Detect card contours and apply perspective correction (homography).
Extract and zoom the top-left corner for symbol isolation.
Split corner into rank and suit regions, extract contours, and resize.
Compare extracted symbols to templates using pixel-wise absolute difference.
Classify based on best match and confidence threshold.
